TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 723-724
TEI.2.document_title: William S Parrott to Stephen F Austin, 12-17-1831

barker_notes.barker_summary: William S. Parrott to Austin, Mexico, December 17, 1831. Concerning indebtedness of S. J. Wilson to him.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 723-724

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William S. Parrott to Austin, Mexico, December 17, 1831. Concerning indebtedness of S. J. Wilson to him.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="12-17-1831">Dec 17th 1831*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Filipe*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*My Dear Sir*person_mentioned* Col. Butler */person_mentioned*advises me of the receipt of a letter from you, communicating the painful intelligence of the Death of My *person_mentioned*Ex. Partner S. J. Willson,*/person_mentioned* and of a protracted illness with which you had suffered; But it afforded me pleasure to hear of your convalesance and hope e'er this you have regained good health, so necessary to enable us to enjoy the temporal blessings of a short life*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Willson */person_mentioned*as you may have learned has been owing me for some time, say since *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1828">1828 */date_mentioned*a large sum, of money drawn from my resources while he was a *person_mentioned*partner */person_mentioned*and in my absence; no part of which I have been able to get of him directly tho I have succeeded in collecting for his a/c here and elsewhere some small amounts compared with principal debt; and I now feel confident he has left Something with which to make on abono if nothing more, and with the hope of having a favourable result, forward this day to *person_mentioned*Thos. J. Chambers Esqr.*/person_mentioned* of your place. My a/c current up to date having a balance without interest in my favour of $21,201-20/100— With a carta poder; to examine into the matter and to recover for me, what he can, tho I am personally acquainted with*person_mentioned* Mr. Chambers*/person_mentioned* I would feel much obliged to you to recommend the matter to him in a special manner.*/p*
*p*When you have leisure, I would thank you to advise me, if I have any chance, to get hold of his grant tho I am half interested in it, of this however no document exists other than his letters,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W. S. Parrott */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
